title: Revenant dragon

properties.name: description
properties.value: The revenant dragon is a type of revenant that inhabits the Revenant Caves, which is a PvP-enabled area that is part of the Wilderness. Like all revenants, they can restore their health when it falls below 50% and will react to a player's protection prayers; wearing a charged bracelet of ethereum will reduce all revenants' damage by 75%.

 This article has a strategy guide here.

The revenant dragon is a type of revenant that inhabits the Revenant Caves, which is a PvP-enabled area that is part of the Wilderness. Like all revenants, they can restore their health when it falls below 50% and will react to a player's protection prayers; wearing a charged bracelet of ethereum will reduce all revenants' damage by 75%.

The Salve amulet can be a good option for killing revenants due to the damage bonus it provides while being easily replaceable, as PKing in the Revenant Caves is extremely common.

An anti-dragon shield or any other equivalent is not needed when fighting these, as they do not use dragonfire. The special effect of dragonstone bolts (e) can occur against a revenant dragon. The dragon hunter crossbow and dragon hunter lance do not have increased accuracy or damage when fighting revenant dragons.

Drops[edit source]

The following drop rates are provided by Jagex, unless otherwise specified.

All revenants share the same drop list. The higher the revenant's level, the higher the chance they drop an item alongside the guaranteed drops. Wearing an amulet of avarice will cause all drops in the Revenant Caves to be noted.

The average revenant dragon kill, including its unique drops, is worth 28,593.37 (unskulled) or 33,567.42 (skulled). Excluding the unique drops, the average revenant dragon kill is worth 27,596 (unskulled) or 31,754 (skulled).

100%[edit source]

Item Quantity Rarity Price High Alch
Revenant ether2–24Always[d 1]298–3,576300–3,600
  1. ↑ Revenant ether is only dropped in even quantity amounts

Unique[edit source]

There is a 1 in 8,000 chance of rolling the unique drop table when unskulled and a 1 in 4,400 chance when skulled. When this table is rolled, there is a 2 in 5 chance of receiving an amulet of avarice and a 1 in 5 chance each of receiving a weapon.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
27 October 2021
(update)
  • The revenant dragon's respawn time was decreased from 30 ticks (18 seconds) to 20 ticks (12 seconds).
  • The revenant's drop table was readjusted again.
  • An additional spawn was added for each revenant.
  • The revenant's healing mechanics were rebalanced.
13 January 2021
(update)

Revenants were made into spectral creatures.

21 October 2020
(update)
  • Increased amount of Revenants in the cave, and spread them over the entirety of the cave
  • Combat zones modified to "singles-plus" - players can still fight revenants, but they can be attacked by another player while fighting them.
  • Being skulled has less impact on drop rates
  • A dwarf multicannon can no longer be set up anywhere within the caves
6 August 2020
(update)
  • Bracelet of Ethereum damage reduction lowered by 25% for a total of 75% damage reduction.
  • The average value of the revenant drop table been reduced by around 20%.
1 March 2018
(update)
  • The magic attack of the Revenants will now target several players at once. Up to 10 players stood on the same tile as the main target will be targeted with the magic attack.
  • The chances of rolling on the normal loot table have been increased slightly.
21 February 2018
(update)
  • Reduced overall value of revenant drops
  • Dwarf multicannons can no longer be placed within the Revenant area of the caves
26 January 2018
(update)
  • Increased the likelihood of landing on the normal loot table instead of coins.
  • Removed some lesser valuable drops and increased quantities of regular loot.
  • Tweaked various weightings across the normal loot table and all 100x drops have been removed.
  • Added Ancient Statuettes to the drop table.
30 November 2017
(update)
  • Revenants now correctly play their correct defend animations.
  • The Slayer gem will now log kills of Revenants.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Despite being a dragon, it is not weak to dragonbane weapons.
  • The revenant dragon is weak to crush attacks, which is unique in the fact that all other dragons are weak to stab attacks.
  • Because of the way the revenant drop table is calculated, revenant dragons are the only type of revenant that doesn't drop coins.
  • On release, the drop rate of magic seeds from revenant dragons was approximately 1 in 11,000.[1]

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ↑ Jagex. Mod Ayiza's Twitter account. (Archived from the original on 28 May 2020.) Mod Ayiza: "Regarding Revenant caves & their drops [1]"

The '''revenant dragon''' is a type of [[revenant]] that inhabits the [[Revenant Caves]], which is a PvP-enabled area that is part of the [[Wilderness]]. Like all revenants, they can restore their health when it falls below 50% and will react to a player's protection prayers; wearing a charged [[bracelet of ethereum]] will reduce all revenants' damage by 75%.

The [[Salve amulet]] can be a good option for killing revenants due to the damage bonus it provides while being easily replaceable, as [[PKing]] in the Revenant Caves is extremely common.

An [[anti-dragon shield]] or any other equivalent is not needed when fighting these, as they do not use [[dragonfire]]. The special effect of [[dragonstone bolts (e)]] ''can'' occur against a revenant dragon. The [[dragon hunter crossbow]] and [[dragon hunter lance]] do '''not''' have increased accuracy or damage when fighting revenant dragons.

==Trivia==
*Despite being a dragon, it is not weak to [[dragonbane weapons]].
*The revenant dragon is weak to crush attacks, which is unique in the fact that all other dragons are weak to stab attacks.
*Because of the way the revenant drop table is calculated, revenant dragons are the only type of revenant that doesn't drop coins.
*On release, the drop rate of magic seeds from revenant dragons was approximately 1 in 11,000.{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ayiza|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAyiza/status/933661157218508800|archiveurl=https://archive.is/KUyRq|archivedate=28 May 2020|quote=Regarding Revenant caves & their drops [https://pbs.twimg.com/media/DPUH2URWsAAXUu1.jpg]}}
